page.title: 13HIGH SUMMER AT MARKLAND HILL
page.content: The tarmac shimmers in the heat haze, Hosepipes revive the sun-burnt grass, The Hill sleeps in afternoon siesta Nimbus clouds drift slowly by. A jet plane's white tail Chalks its route into the blue. Brown bikini-clad bodies soak up sun And from hidden patios and gardens The ring of china cup on china saucer. In tree-bordered privacy of the club, The distant thwack of ball on gut, The umpire keeping score Tennis champions play no part In the timeless afternoon's lethargy. Reluctant pupils in the schools at the top Swelter in oppresive heat Claps from the field-a player's out In pools of shade beneath the trees Last stitches are sewn in girl's samplers And from the hall young voices ring.
